description:
Founded in 2001, Cabrera Capital Markets LLC is a growing investment bank and institutional brokerage firm. Headquartered in Chicago, IL the firm specializes in providing investment banking for municipal, corporate, and advisory clients, as well as institutional brokerage services for municipal bonds, global equities, taxable fixed income securities, preferred equities, and cash management services. The firm also has a growing Real Estate practice​. Cabrera Capital is proud to be a certified Minority-Owned Business Enterprise (MBE) serving a diversified global client base that includes institutional entities across the globe.

The Real Estate Finance Analyst will be a critical member of the team supporting the promotion of Cabrera Capital Partners products and services. The analyst will create valuation and cash flow models and conduct in depth market research. Furthermore, the analyst will be involved in underwriting real estate transactions and providing critical risk analysis. The individual will also support the real estate principals and team on strategy for existing and future development projects.

Duties and Responsibilities:
• Perform in depth real estate market analysis for a wide range of public and private entities using all accepted and relevant approaches and theory
• Design, understand and employ valuation models for discounted cash flow analysis (Argus and Excel), comparable property sales models, and construction cost models
• Perform comparative analysis for properties, analyzing contract and market rental rates using discounted cash flow modeling
• Prepare confidential information memoranda, management presentations, marketing materials, pitch books and other presentations as needed
• Provide credit analysis/underwriting for new transactions and ensure it is conducted efficiently and timely within existing policies
• Review real estate industry surveys and benchmarks, economics, and demographic trends
• Provide reports about real estate development funding sources including, TIF, tax credit, economic development, infrastructure, and other available grant programs (i.e. - public, private, philanthropic…)
• Shadow internal and external meetings/presentations to gain an awareness of client profiles and transactions
• Ensure that all client needs are consistently met and strive to exceed client expectations
• All other duties as assigned
• 3-5 years of financial analysis or valuation advisory experience
• Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, business, applied mathematics, statistics, engineering, or equivalent quantitative field. Master’s Degree is a big plus
• A fundamental understanding of financial valuation theory, methodologies, and applications
• Strong analytical abilities including the ability to model discounted cash flows and understand basic probability and statistical concepts
• Experience with LIHTC Programs is HIGHLY preferred
• Review and processing of construction and loan draws a plus.
• Strong professional communication and inter-personal skills, with the ability to succinctly express complex ideas verbally and in writing
• Ability to work independently and in a team environment; prioritize tasks, and solve critical business issues
• Advanced proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, Word, etc.…
• Ability to maintain confidentiality, multi-task and work well under pressure
• Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
• Retirement Plan (401k with company match, IRA)
• Employee Profit Sharing Plan
• Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D, Group Whole Life)
• Short Term & Long Term Disability
• Accident and Critical Illness Benefit Plans
• Paid Time Off (Vacation time)
• Follow the NYSE Holiday Schedule
• Building Amenities Include: Exclusive Lounge areas, 24/7 Gym/Wellness Center (monthly membership fee applies), lounge areas, building food hall and more...
